AdditionalFields.Value: Bioinformatics / Computational Biology / Systems Biology / Convergent Science,Cancer Evolution

Description: This session will provide an overview of three popular software tools for analyzing large cancer datasets. These tools are widely used and highly accessible to any scientist: they are all web-based and have rich graphical user interfaces. The tools to be presented in this session are: (1) the Galaxy platform (https://galaxyproject.org/), a computational workbench with thousands of tools for performing bulk and single-cell omics analyses, image processing, machine learning, and many more kinds of biomedical analyses; (2) the cBioPortal for Cancer Genomics (https://www.cbioportal.org/), which provides visualization, analysis, and download of large-scale cancer genomics data sets; and (3) the Xena Functional Genomics Explorer (https://xenabrowser.net/), a web application that enables users to explore functional genomic data sets for correlations between genomic and/or phenotypic variables.
PrimaryCategory: Bioinformatics / Computational Biology / Systems Biology / Convergent Science
SearchResultBody: MW005. Accessible Computational Platforms for Large-Scale Cancer Data Analyses
Title: Accessible Computational Platforms for Large-Scale Cancer Data Analyses
